subject: Management
title: The Brilliant Jerk Problem
description: Learn The Brilliant Jerk Problem in one minute.

hook.text: A top salesperson generated $2M in revenue and caused $5M in turnover from teammates who quit.

buildup.text: Brilliant jerks produce results individually but destroy team performance around them.

discovery.text: Netflix's principle: no brilliant jerks. The cost to teamwork always exceeds their individual output.

twist.text: Keeping them sends a message: results matter more than values. That message poisons everything.

climax.text: Act fast. Coach once, set clear expectations, then move on if behavior doesn't change.

punchline.text: One toxic star costs more than their brilliance is worth.

quiz.question: Why should organizations not tolerate brilliant jerks?
options: Their damage to team performance exceeds their individual contribution
Brilliant people are always difficult to manage
Jerks never produce meaningful individual results
